cleaned_text: Public Health Information Public Health Information Page updated 9/5/23 COVID-19 Information and Resources Free COVID Test Kits at Select Library Locations At-home COVID-19 test kits, are free until supplies run out at the Library's and [Wyoming, opens a new window](https://chpl.org/locations/WY) Branch Libraries. - Please [check availability](https://chpl.org/ask-librarian/)before visiting a branch library for pickup. - You do not need to present ID or have a library card to get a test kit. - The Ohio Department of Health limits four test kit boxes per day per household. - These kits cannot be used for return/stay in school or for travel. - Our COVID-19 tests are for individual household use. - For help with COVID testing in support of small businesses, please contact [kwalton@cincinnatichamber.com](mailto:KWalton@cincinnatichamber.com). - Funding thanks to the Ohio Library Council in partnership with the Ohio Department of Health. Free COVID On-Site Testing in Hamilton County On-site COVID-19 testing is available in our community. Self-Report Results of At-Home Test Kits Self-report your COVID-19 test results to protect our community and help with public health decisions. [Use this secure website, opens a new window](https://www.cincinnati-oh.gov/health/covid-19/covid-19-testing/) to report the results of your at-home test. Get Vaccinated in Hamilton County Vaccines are available for ages 6 months and above. Updated COVID-19 vaccinations, designed to protect us from current variants, are expected to begin in the [fall of 2023](https://www.fda.gov/vaccines-blood-biologics/updated-covid-19-vaccines-use-united-states-beginning-fall-2023). Questions About the Vaccine Call 1-833-4-ASK-ODH (1-833-427-5634) Ohio Department of Health's call center is staffed 9 a.m.-8 p.m. every day. How can I tell which information about vaccines is true? The best thing you can do is educate yourself about the vaccines with information from trustworthy sources. Learn how to find credible information in [this article from the CDC, opens a new window](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/vac-gen/evalwebs.htm), and about the [benefits of getting vaccinated from Ohio Department of Health, opens a new window](https://odh.ohio.gov/media-center/odh-news-releases/odh-news-release-10-05-21). View More FAQs at [Coronavirus.Ohio.gov, opens a new window](https://coronavirus.ohio.gov/home). Fact-Based Library Resources and Links Our staff has gathered information about and by health and medical experts to help keep you and your family safe. Resources include websites, books, and eBooks. ACTIV-6 Study In partnership with the [University of Cincinnati College of Medicine, opens a new window](https://www.uc.edu/news/articles/2022/02/university-of-cincinnati-joins-nationwide-clinical-study-to-test-medications-for-mild-to-moderate-covid-19.html), the ACTIV-6 study is helping researchers understand how existing medications can improve symptoms and limit hospitalizations for people with mild-to-moderate COVID-19.
